edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.sigmaProtocol.orMultiple
Class SigmaORMultipleVerifierComputation

java.lang.Object
  edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.sigmaProtocol.orMultiple.SigmaORMultipleVerifierComputation
All Implemented Interfaces:
SigmaVerifierComputation
public class SigmaORMultipleVerifierComputation
extends java.lang.Object
implements SigmaVerifierComputation

Concrete implementation of Sigma Protocol verifier computation.

This protocol is used for a prover to convince a verifier that at least k out of n statements is true, where each statement can be proven by an associated Sigma protocol.

The pseudo code of this protocol can be found in Protocol 1.16 of pseudo codes document at http://crypto.biu.ac.il/scapi/SDK_Pseudocode_SCAPI_V2.0.0.pdf.

Author:
Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

Constructor Detail

SigmaORMultipleVerifierComputation

public SigmaORMultipleVerifierComputation(java.util.ArrayList<SigmaVerifierComputation> verifiers,
                                          int t,
                                          java.security.SecureRandom random)
Constructor that gets the underlying verifiers.

Parameters:
verifiers - array of SigmaVerifierComputation, where each object represent a statement and the prover wants to convince a verifier that at least k out of n statements is true.
t - soundness parameter. t MUST be equal to all t values of the underlying verifiers object.
random - source of randomness
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given t is not equal to all t values of the underlying verifiers object.

sampleChallenge

public void sampleChallenge()
Samples the challenge of the protocol.

"SAMPLE a single random challenge e <- GF[2^t]".

Specified by:

verify

public boolean verify(SigmaCommonInput in,
                      SigmaProtocolMsg a,
                      SigmaProtocolMsg z)
Computes the verification of the protocol.

"ACC IFF Q is of degree n-k AND Q(i)=ei for all i=1,…,n AND Q(0)=e, and the verifier output on (ai,ei,zi) for all i=1,…,n is ACC".

Specified by:
verify in interface SigmaVerifierComputation
Parameters:
input - MUST be an instance of SigmaORMultipleCommonInput.
a - first message from prover
z - second message from prover
Returns:
true if the proof has been verified; false, otherwise.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if input is not an instance of SigmaORMultipleCommonInput.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the number of given inputs is different from the number of underlying verifier.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the first message of the prover is not an instance of SigmaMultipleMsg
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the second message of the prover is not an instance of SigmaORMultipleSecondMsg
